reviews.review_msg: I took the course with the 3-hr lecture every week format. Her lectures were quite heavy with information and there was a small groupwork assignment last 10 minutes of every lecture. The exams are fair, all the material is practiced in the assignments, and she is a solid lecturer. Not an easy A, but with some work definitely attainable!
dont take it. his exam is harder than other teachers who have ever tought ling200
dont have to go to class. I learn by myself, the score was even higher than go to lec. study at home is more efficiency. dont have to look at book just the PPT.
not respected students' work

If you want to get a higher grade in this course. Please choose other instructors. His final is hard and you have to read the whole textbook so than you will not get a bad grade. His lecture is useless and all you can do is to practice a lot.

I took this class because I needed one more lower division to graduate. I love linguistics and I am a constant B to B+ student in Linguistic. I have taken upper division classes in Linguistics that are easier than this. Its not the content that is difficult but his exams are way more difficult than they need to be.

One of the easiest electives I have taken @ SFU. Buy the textbook for practices, don't really have to read it because his notes already includes all the main points you'll need. The rest is just practice. You don't really have to study for final if you are on track throughout the semester. Easy A, hard to A+.

He is a great professor for this course.  I'd recommend him to teach LING 200.  But I have heard he makes LING 110 really hard.  He is passionate about this material, so it's good!  He has a lot of office hours, and if you've taken grammar in high school, the level of difficulty isn't too hard.  Just read the book, do the practices!
85% spent going over homework, 10% waiting for people to answer homework questions, only 5% of the time spent actually teaching us the course material.
I would recommend the teacher but not the specific class. The textbook was extremely useful. Burgess is really good for having extra office hours before midterms and finals.
Took both LING 100 & 200 with him. Great Prof. Really passionate about what he is teaching. Love his lecture style, keeps me awake. Not so easy to get high marks though.

great prof, very professional, organized and funny, Tests are fair, but the fianl is bit tricky. NEGATIVE:answer your question in a round about way to let you think about it first.  Do study hard! If you are good at grammar, you are taking advantages of taking this course. it's just like math, you either get it or you don't!

I like cliff a lot! Notes r very clear so that u dont need to attend the lecture at all. He posted sample exams for all midterms and final which is extremely helpful. Kinda fun 2! dont know the final yet.But I will take other courses with him definitely.
No Comments
Great prof!

um...he is very responsible and serious for his teaching...so just be quiet in his class and do whatever he said to u~besides, dont try to argue with him...his tests r kinda fair...i got pretty high markd on MTs but Final~he really puts too much on final~so work hard!
total right! tries to b funny but not at all, quizzes/exams are completely diff. than what we did in class. final was brutal, i recommend NOT to take ANY courses with him, u'll regret, people!
funny and cute:), makes u laugh through the lecture, and he`s the best in LING DEPT,. Lectures are clear and well-organized,nice guy!
good prof quiz is a little bit hard ,but lecture is good.
best prof. ever! well-organized. easy to follow. but little hard on quiz though... very helpful. interesting lecture. not boring even though three hours night class~
Hard material, but he is so helpful.  Very student-friendly teaching style.  Remembers faces from a lecture hall of 100's.

Trevor is one of the best TAs I have encountered at SFU when I was taking LING220. He is very knowledgable about the subject and knows how to explain hard theories. While taking LING200, he was an instructor and provided problems to solve in each class which is great for practice and ask questions if you get stuck. All in all, you get what you put

Do all of the homework and read all of the slides and you will do well. Trevors test questions are just like the homework and sample tests but a little harder. Funny guy too and he cares a lot about us individually.
Trevor feels like a friend helping you out with studying for a course. He is supportive and tries hard to explain things more easily for us. I hope he teaches more.

This class was hard but professor Block made lots of time for me when I need help. The later exams were hard like the final exam high score is 51/60 but then he made it out of 50. I think he is very friendly compared to most professors. I went to office hours before assignments were due and he checked my work so I have 100% on it. great guy :)

I am three weeks into this course my second time. I took a few linguistics courses already and Trevor is already the best professor yet. Well see how the first midterm goes but pick him over any other person teaching this course. I hope he teaches 300 courses because I don't want to suffer anymore lol.

the course was a lot harder than i thought it would be. trevor helped out a lot outside of class and he tried to keep the lectures funny sometimes because the stuff we learn can be boring. thats the big thing. i found out i dont like grammar. if you dont like grammar then avoid!!! the exams were really hard too but he scaled them thank god lol

Tough course but Trevor is the kindest prof I've had and is always willing to help, most likely due to the fact that he is still quite young and knows exactly what university students go through. Make sure to do the homework questions and ALL of the recommended questions as it will help you get a good sense of what is expected on tests.

This is a heavy course with lots of material, but Trevor does a great job at explaining everything by providing many different examples throughout his lecture slides, and assigning homework/assignments that are relevant to his exams. Overall, the course was quite overwhelming but I highly recommend taking a course with Trevor!

This course is really tough and the exams are really tough but Trevor knows that and gives many free marks after each exam. His examples are funny and there are many memes. There are lots of practice problems in lecture and in the homeworks but its still tough. But he will spend lots of time in office hours with you and give tips!

I took her Ling100 course originally and it went well, so I decided to take another course with her. Apparently that was a mistake, as all of our lectures were prerecorded from the semester before, there was barely any communication and she would constantly be regrading tests and midterms. I had to learn everything on my own. Don't recommend

Trude is a nice prof, but the worst at the same time. If there was a question on the exam many students think were "unfair or marked wrong", she'll give the point. But if you got it right the first time, then you'll lose a mark when it is re-graded. Your mark will suffer with her!

I loved Dr. Heift! She is so sweet and caring. She provides clear/detailed responses to questions and spends a lot of time going over the exams explaining the answers. The class has a quiz each week, so make sure you attend and pay attention. You have to study a lot to do well in this course and the material gets harder as the semester goes on!

Very understanding caring professor. She goes over exams and explains the questions well. She wants her students to succeed and makes room for her students to explain why the question may have been confusing or too hard.

Trude is a brilliant professor/person. She is really passionate about her profession and wants her students to succeed, but she also wants students to get the mark they deserve in terms of putting in time and effort. I missed 3 classes and it really took a toll on my grade. I suggest always being present and you will get a really good grade!

This guy is very unfriendly to students. He suspects many of us without evidence and talks to them through Zoom. His tone is very uncomfortable during the conversation and he made confusing problems in the final to reduce our scores. His grading scheme is very unreasonable. if you want to get A-, you should get at least 89%.
He is so kind. The best prof I have met.

There's a reason why SFU doesn't let you know who the prof is for this class PRIOR to the semester starting - if anyone knew she'd be teaching and looked her up on ratemyprofessors, everyone would drop the course. Yeah, she's that bad. She's great at trickery. The homework is easy but tests are hard. It's really discouraging.

Her tests are awfully hard. Don't take this course unless you want to become an ESL teacher. This is NOT a good elective class, and if you wanna learn ESL from her, you won't. I know this 'cuz my class is full of non-native English speaking students who are failing. I guess she's nice as a person, but tough when it comes to the course.
PLEASE Do NOT TAKE THIS COURSE WITH THIS TEACHER UNLESS YOU WANT TO FAIL IT!

Was horrified when i found out she was my teacher for Ling 200!! Had her for Ling 110 and didn't do well in the class and i should've learned my lesson and dropped the class immdiately.. her exams are difficult.. and she's a nice lady.. but her lectures are so boring.. hard marker.. :( Will never take a class with her again..
Susan is AWFUL. Avoid her at all costs. She gets enjoyment out of tricking you on tests. Don't risk your GPA with her!

Susan is a very poor teacher. Her teaching method is lack-luster, she puts very little effort into planning her lessons, and she expects a massive return from her students. She puts obscure knowledge and things we have yet to study in class in her quizzes. Also, she is a retentive marker.
If you want to fail, take this course. She is worst prof ever,  boring & tricky.

u might want to consider taking this class w/another prof if you seriously want to get some stuff out of it. she expects you to write at the speed that she talks--result? cut off notes in ALL your notes. quizzes are very tough.definitely not enough time to answer all the questions! be ready to treat this as a dis.ed. course! gd l.
bad prof...

Susan is a very pleasant professor with a great attitude. I enjoyed her class and got out of it what I expectedâ€¦an introduction to grammar. Don't take this class if you are looking for an in depth analysis of English.  Tests are tough but it is definitely possible to do very well in this class with a little effort.
This is not an easy course. The course should be easy, but the prof made so many traps on the midterms and fianl. Becareful~~~~
No Comments
she is great! if you are not doing well in this course, i am sure that you are not studying. Her notes are clear and you don't even need to read the text. aswsome prof.!
she puts too much effects on how to make the quizes as hard as possible. it's unbelievable
No Comments
Seems like a nice person; however, her quizzes are too hard.  Very picky maker.
she is very good at making easy stuff hard
Truly an amazing instructor, would definitely take another class with her, will easily recommend to anyone thinking about taking a course with her !

She was so lovely, taking another class with her next semester! Lecture isn't mandatory per se, but if you want to understand the content well then highly recommend you attend. She's very interactive and provides a lot of examples which helps a lot with your understanding.

Eva is lovely, but this course can be a grind. Weekly assignments aren't terrible, but they get more complex and confusing over time. 2 group projects: should be okay if you have a solid group. Exams are tough as nails no matter how much you study, as the content is pretty dense. Love the prof, not so much the course. Take it only if necessary!
Class material is interesting and makes sense. Exams were unnecessary difficult. Only take if you need this class and are ready to put in hours to keep up.

Eva was a wonderful professor! I thoroughly enjoyed her Ling200 course, however do be aware that you will have to put in the work and participate to get a good grade! Group projects and group assignments were fairly marked, but the exams were a bit difficult and the median was typically 60%.

Eva is an amazing prof where she takes the time to make sure that her students understand the content. The course itself is tough but she makes it better with her organized notes. Beware a lot of time is needed to do the homework and assignments. Only wish there were no group assignments due when another major thing is due like an exam.

I really enjoyed taking Eva's course this semester! She is an amazing and approachable prof. She designed the course so you could get a good mark even though the tests were hard. Obviously, Ling 200 is not designed as a gpa booster! Take it if you really need to, and I would suggested it with Eva 100%
She is a really good professor. Helpful and friendly. Her midterm is easy and the practice is really close. I almost get A+ in midterms. It's a gpa booster for students who are good at grammar.

Dr. Rimrott is very caring. She goes over slides in great detail and answers questions well. She also gives out lots of extra practice, which is needed for this course. I really enjoyed having her as a professor!
She is the best instructor I have ever had

really responsible, the best the most complicate Moodle page I've ever seen! and really helpful! but her class is really difficult. Moreover, she is a weird person. She always show she is a German and how pound she is because she is a German although she do not have relationship with Germany at all. What a funny guy!

Anne is the best prof I've had so far, and I'm not in ling. Her lectures are long but engaging, she posts all material online. There are workshops and office hours if you need help. Weekly homework and discussion. Graded group worksheet each class. Participation matters. She posts study guides. If you read the book & attend lecture you'll pass.
I believe this course is one of the easiest courses at SFU! Exams are fair, and you will have no problem if you do all practice questions before exams:) You should take this course with her.
Very unclear.
Her classes are so easy.  She's so easy going and pretty flexible with anything.
hot

i think she is good at teaching because she teaches at the speed of a snail. it takes her 1-2 weeks to teach one chapter. that is good for students because there is less to study. HOWEVER, she seems very reluctant to take her time outside of class or office hours to help students. plus, she tends to introduce new "parsing labels" ON EXAM DAYS. ugh
Anyway, she is hot. but I did all work back my home and never showed up into class, her class is not hard at all
She is absolutely useless and boring. She has no interest in what she's teaching. She shows up late to every class. She is not prepared. Lectures notes are not available. Avoid!
